Biography of this account.

TL;DR: posting 30% I.T. knowledge or privacy, 30% politics, 40% shit posting of my life.

>"Loopback"?
>>A technical term usually refers to "the routing of electronic signals, digital data streams", or more generally "flows of items back to their source without intentional processing or modification".

> So what, why you choose "Loopback" as username?
>>In real life, most of the things you tried to change go back to its original state, regardless effort you put into it. It may seems pointless, yet depressing. Depressing maybe, "Loopback" is the perfect word to describe many things.

>Another random user sharing his feeling in ZeroMe.
>>I cannot deny it, I may post some of my feeling from time to time. However, I want to *contribute* something, instead of posting random stuffs. Most of the posts will be related to I.T. and politics or such, the rest is shit posting of my life. If this account posts too much negative feelings, please send help. :)

ZeroMe markdown
#\#This is H1 heading
##\##H2 heading

> \> Quote
>> \>> Even more quote

\*\***Achtung!**\*\*
\**Italic only useful in harvard referencing*\*
`` `Please, put code in code block` ``

* \* Bullet one
* \* two

[\[URL to ZeroNet default homepage\]\(/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/\)](/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/)

To secure ZeroNet installation, this post provides some additional security layers.

Objectives:
* (optional) prevent data leakage to clearnet (make sure Tor only) 
* further limit accessible files outside ZeroNet directory
* limits system call
* drop all Linux capabilites and privilege escalation

## Credit
This is my own work.
Respect other work, give credit/referencing/citation if you have respect.

# Warning !
This is a work of process, *no warranty of any kind* !

Environment:
Debian \ Ubuntu 
As long as it is not EOL

Requirement:
`iptables` and `firejail`
(optional) `tor`

Steps:

1. We first create a user account `zeronet`.

	```
	useradd -m zeronet
	```

2. Put your `ZeroNet` directory to the `zeronet` home directory, e.g. `/home/zeronet`.

3. Install `firejail`, which "is a SUID program that reduces the risk of security breaches by restricting the running environment of untrusted applications using Linux namespaces and seccomp-bpf" according to its [offical webpage(firejail.wordpress.com)](https://firejail.wordpress.com/).

	```
	
	apt-get install firejail
	```

4. Add firejail profile for zeronet, i.e. create and copy the following content to `/etc/firejail/zeronet.profile` with your text editor.

	```
	include /etc/firejail/globals.local
	
	caps.drop all
	ipc-namespace
	netfilter
	no3d
	nodvd
	nonewprivs
	noroot
	nosound
	notv
	novideo
	protocol unix,inet,inet6
	seccomp
	x11 none
	
	disable-mnt
	private
	private-dev
	private-tmp
	whitelist /home/zeronet
	```

5. (optional) Configure ZeroNet to use tor

	Refers to the [ZeroNet official docs (readthedocs.io)](http://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/#how-to-make-zeronet-work-with-tor-under-linux) 

6. (optional) Prevent data leak outside tor

	```
	iptables -A OUTPUT -o lo -m owner --uid-owner zeronet -j ACCEPT
	iptables -A OUTPUT -m owner --uid-owner zeronet -j REJECT
	```

7. (optional) Configure systemd to control zeronet, by creating and copying the following content to file `/etc/systemd/system/zeronet.service`

	Remember to change `ExecStart` to appropriate ZeroNet location and change according to the comment **if you don't need tor always mode**.
	
	```
	[Unit]
	Description=ZeroNet
	After=network-online.target tor.service
	# Remove "tor.service" in the above line if you don't need tor always mode
	Requires=tor.service 
	# Remove the above line if you don't need tor always mode
	BindsTo=tor.service
	# Remove the above line if you don't need tor always mode
	[Service]
	Type=simple
	User=zeronet
	Group=zeronet
	ExecStart=/usr/bin/firejail --profile=/etc/firejail/zeronet.local python /home/zeronet/ZeroNet-master/zeronet.py
	# Change above line to your location of zeronet directory if needed
	Restart=on-failure
	
	[Install]
	WantedBy=multi-user.target tor.service
	# Remove "tor.service" in the above line if you don't need tor always mode
	```

8. Start your sandboxed ZeroNet
e.g. `systemctl start zeronet`

9. Profit

# Limitations, help needed
* (help needed) ~~ZeroNet~~ Any program inside the sandbox (including ZeroNet) still able to access localhost service intentionally or not , due to bug/mis-configuration, e.g. 80/443 port if running nginx, or even socks proxy that allow escape of outgoing firewall
* (can't fix) Any exploit that breaks sandbox(firejail)/kernel security layer
